ygData.subject: Re: WEAPONS for my PET
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes but it is a hindrance, by then they hit better Without weapons, also If you come up against a wisp, or ghoul you are in trouble because it won t be able to
ygData.messageBody:
Yes but it is a hindrance, by then they hit better Without weapons, also If
you come up against a wisp, or ghoul you are in trouble because it won't be
able to hit the monster, unless you give it magic weapons.

<-- Enigma -->
http://members.door.net/enigma

From: Tony B [SMTP:tonyb72@...]

Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] WEAPONS for my PET

From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>

that brings up a point i was curious about. does that mean a 16 lvl pet
will get dual wield? i cant remember exactly, but i think ive seen a skel
with two weapons.

belphenor


>From: Guillaume Voizard <gvoizard@...>
>
>You can give a weapon to your pet, but you can not take it back. :o(
>I think that pets have the same level of knowledge than a warrior of the
>same level. So you can give him any weapon you want, but you must know
that
>it will be lost for you. So if you have a huge amount of hundreds of
>platinum, may be you can waste some dwarven battle axes for your pets.
:o)
>About dmg, think about your pet as a warrior who maxed his skills. No
>weapon
>-> hand to hand, weapon -> more dmg (but what about the delay ?)
>
>Taldir, Teir'Dal in Innoruuk.
>
>
>-----Original Message-----

>

>
